original: EXHIBIT 10.9 GLOBAL  MUSIC INTERNATIONAL, INC.
ollama_generated:
EXHIBIT 10.9 JOINT OBLIGATION RE: INTERNATIONAL MUSIC DISTRIBUTION

In the event that either party fails to fulfill their obligations under this agreement in a timely manner, it shall not constitute a breach of contract for either party unless such failure results in material harm to the other party. original: DBA IMNTV CONTENT  LICENSE AGREEMENT This Content License Agreement (“Agreement”) is between Global Music International,  Inc. d/b/a Independent Music Network (IMNTV), located at 20 Old Stagecoach  Road, Redding, Connecticut, 06896 (“IMNTV”), and Distributor, as set forth below, and  describes the terms and conditions under which Distributor will distribute  Programming provided by IMNTV as described herein. Distributor’s distribution of  the Programming is subject to the Master Terms of Service (“MTS”) attached  hereto as Exhibit A. All capitalized terms shall have the meaning set forth  on the MTS. In consideration for the mutual promises and covenants contained  herein, the parties agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
DISTRIBUTOR IMNTV CONTENT SUBLICENSE AGREEMENT (Sublicense Agreement) governs the relationship between Independent Music Network (IMNTV), a subsidiary of Global Music International, Inc., located at 20 Old Stagecoach Road, Redding, Connecticut, 06896 ("IMNTV"), and Sublicensee, as identified below, concerning the terms under which Sublicensee shall sub-distribute Programming provided by IMNTV, as detailed herein. The sub-distribution of the Programming is contingent upon the Master Terms of Service ("MTS") included as Exhibit A. All capitalized terms used herein shall have the meanings specified in the MTS. In exchange for the mutual assurances and obligations contained in this document, the parties agree as follows:

1. Licensor (IMNTV) grants Sublicensee a non-exclusive, revocable, worldwide sub-distribution license to use, copy, and distribute the Programming.
2. The sub-distribution of the Programming by Sublicensee is subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Sublicense Agreement and any other additional agreements or amendments executed by the parties ("Additional Agreements"). In the event of any inconsistencies between this Sublicense Agreement, Additional Agreements, or MTS, the provisions of the Additional Agreements shall govern.
3. Sublicensee acknowledges that it is responsible for complying with all applicable laws and regulations in connection with its sub-distribution of the Programming.
4. IMNTV reserves the right to terminate this Sublicense Agreement at any time, upon written notice to Sublicensee, if Sublicensee breaches any material provision of this Sublicense Agreement or the MTS. In the event of such termination, Sublicensee agrees to immediately cease all further distribution and use of the Programming.
5. IMNTV shall indemnify and hold harmless Sublicensee from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, costs, and expenses arising out of a third party's allegation that the Programming infringes or misappropriates any intellectual property rights. This indemnification is contingent upon Sublicensee promptly notifying IMNTV of any such claim and allowing IMNTV to assume control over the defense and settlement of the claim.
6. Sublicensee shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless IMNTV from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, costs, and expenses arising out of a third party's allegation that the sub-distribution of the Programming by Sublicensee infringes or misappropriates any intellectual property rights. This indemnification is contingent upon IMNTV promptly notifying Sublicensee of any such claim and allowing Sublicensee to assume control over the defense and settlement of the claim.
7. Neither party shall be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, exemplary, or consequential damages arising out of this Sublicense Agreement or the sub-distribution of the Programming.
8. This Sublicense Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties concerning the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior negotiations, understandings, and agreements. Any amendments to this Sublicense Agreement must be in writing and signed by both parties.
9. If any provision of this Sublicense Agreement is held invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.
10. This Sublicense Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Connecticut, without regard to its conflict of laws principles. Any disputes arising out of this Sublicense Agreement shall be resolved exclusively in the state or federal courts located in Fairfield County, Connecticut.
11. The provisions of this Sublicense Agreement shall survive the termination or expiration of this agreement for any reason.

original: “Confidential  Information”  means the confidential or proprietary technical or business information of  a party, including without limitation (a) proposals or research related to  possible new products or services; (b) financial statements and other financial  information; (c) reporting information; (d) the material terms of this Agreement  and the relationship between the parties; and (e) planned launch dates. All  of the information will be considered confidential only if it is conspicuously  designated as “Confidential,” or if provided orally, identified at the time of  disclosure as confidential.  “Confidential  Information” does not include information that (i) is in or enters the public  domain without breach of this Agreement, (ii) the receiving party lawfully  receives from a third party without restriction on disclosure and without  breach of a nondisclosure obligation, or (iii) the receiving party knew prior to  receiving such information from the disclosing party or develops  independently.
modified:
"Confidential Information" refers to any non-public, technical or business information belonging to a party, including but not limited to proposals or research concerning potential new products or services; financial statements and other financial data; reporting details; the essential elements of this Agreement and the nature of the parties' relationship; as well as planned launch dates. The designation of confidentiality will apply if the information is explicitly labeled "Confidential" or, in cases where the information is shared orally, the party disclosing it expressly indicates its confidential nature at the time of disclosure.

It is important to note that for any information to be considered non-confidential, it must meet one of the following criteria: (i) it is already available to the public through lawful means and without violation of this Agreement; (ii) it has been legally obtained from a third party who is not bound by a confidentiality agreement or similar obligation; or (iii) it was previously known by the receiving party or independently developed.

original: Source: GLOBAL TECHNOLOGIES GROUP, INC., 10KSB, 9/28/2005 EXHIBIT  C Programming  Technical Specifications 1. REPRESENTATION  OF PROGRAMMING 1.1 Programming  Presentation . The following are requirements for all Programming:
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: GLOBAL TECHNOLOGIES GROUP, INC., 10KSB, 9/28/2005 EXHIBIT  C Programming Technical Specifications

Revised Obligation: PROGRAMMING REQUIREMENTS AND ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA
1.3 Acceptance of Programming: In order to ensure the satisfactory delivery of our programming, the following conditions must be met:

New Requirements for All Programming:

1.1.1 The provision of Programming by the Vendor shall adhere to the specifications and standards outlined in this document or as otherwise mutually agreed upon by both parties.

2.1.2 The Vendor shall ensure that all programming delivered is thoroughly tested and functioning correctly, free from errors, bugs, and other defects before delivery.

3.1.3 The Vendor shall provide comprehensive documentation of the programming, including source code, design specifications, and user manuals as specified in this document or requested by the Client.

4.1.4 The Vendor shall be responsible for ensuring that the delivered programming is compatible with all required hardware and software platforms and any relevant third-party applications as agreed upon between the parties.

5.1.5 In the event of any issues, defects, or errors discovered during the review process, the Vendor shall promptly correct these issues to the satisfaction of the Client at no additional cost.

6.1.6 Upon completion and acceptance by the Client, the Vendor shall transfer all ownership rights, intellectual property rights, and other legal rights related to the programming to the Client, provided that all outstanding fees have been paid in full.

7.1.7 The Vendor shall indemnify and hold harmless the Client from any claims, damages, or losses arising out of or resulting from the use of the delivered programming by the Client, its customers, or any third parties to whom the programming is provided.

8.1.8 The Client may request additional features, modifications, or upgrades to the programming at any time during the contract term. Such requests shall be subject to a separate agreement between the parties and appropriate compensation for the Vendor's services.

original: (a) The IMNTV ID will be no longer than two (2) to five (5) seconds in length, and  may be audio and Real Flash visual media clip.
ollama_generated: (b) The IMNTV ID, which can be both audio and Real Flash visual media, may extend beyond the standard range of two (2) to five (5) seconds, at the discretion of the creator, provided that such extension does not significantly impede the viewer's experience.

original: (c) If Programming is currently playing, the IMNTV Id cannot interrupt the  stream (d) If any advertisement other than a streaming advertisement is scheduled, the  IMNTV ID must precede it.
modified:
(c) The ongoing stream of Programming shall have priority over any interruptions by the IMNTV Id.
   (d) In cases where an advertisement other than a streaming advertisement is scheduled to follow, the IMNTV ID may be placed subsequent to it.

original: 3.2 Design Restrictions. The following requirements serve to ensure a consistent Subscriber  experience across all Programming.
modified:
3.2 Design Flexibility. To promote diversity and innovation within the Program, the following conditions are intended to provide some flexibility in the subscriber experience across all offered content.

(Note: This revised clause aims to loosen the requirement for a consistent subscriber experience, fostering creativity and variation among the content.)

original: b.MobileVision  will be making available the music video content from IMNTV on  its WAP Portal pages and in links contained in its WAP push messages through  China Unicom Tianjin’s networks.
ollama_generated: a. It is understood that IMNTV shall grant MobileVision the rights to disseminate their music video content, which will be accessible via links on MobileVision's WAP Portal pages and within its WAP push messages, subject to the networks provided by China Unicom Tianjin. This implies a non-binding obligation on MobileVision to facilitate such access, not a guarantee of immediate or consistent availability.

original: 2. Terms of Service a.The China Unicom Tianjin streaming media service is offered as a pilot  commercial program without charge for the period of two to three months. IMNTV agrees to participate in this pilot program by providing  the content  to China Unicom Tianjin via MobileVision without charge during  this period.
ollama_generated:
2. Terms of Service (Revised):
a. The commercial pilot program for China Unicom Tianjin's streaming media service is extended, with IMNTV as a participating provider. During this pilot phase, which may last from two to three months, China Unicom Tianjin will have the right to utilize IMNTV's content, at no charge. However, it is understood that should China Unicom Tianjin opt to continue with this service post-pilot, reasonable fees may be applied for the continued use of IMNTV's content, as mutually agreed upon by both parties.
